title: LeBron out 3-4 weeks, expected to miss opener

title: The Hindu Group‚Äôs coffee-table book on legendary illustrator Maniam released
content: Veteran actor Sivakumar, an artist himself, released the first copy of the book, produced in association with Maniam Selven, the son of the late illustrator

title: Supreme Court rejects Centre‚Äôs plea for stricter timelines for execution of death row convicts

title: Punjabi Actor And Bodybuilder Varinder Ghuman Dies Of Heart Attack
content: Professional bodybuilder and actor Varinder Singh Ghuman passed away following a heart attack on Thursday, his family has said.

title: Trump Suggests Spain Be Expelled From NATO Over Low Defense Spending
content: President Donald Trump suggested Thursday that Spain be expelled from NATO over its failure to match the higher defense spending requirement he has engineered.

title: Trump To Visit Middle East Sunday Following Gaza Ceasefire Announcement
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday he plans to leave on Sunday to visit the Middle East following successful negotiations on the first phase of a Gaza peace plan, including a ceasefire and hostage release.

title: PM Modi Congratulates Israeli PM Netanyahu On Gaza Peace Plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday to congratulate him on the progress made under US President Donald Trump's Gaza Peace Plan.

title: Luxury Cars, Gold And Honey: Recovery From Retired Madhya Pradesh Engineer
content: Bhopal woke up to a real-life crime thriller on Thursday as the anti-corruption ombudsman Lokayukta raided the residence and properties of retired Public Works Department (PWD) Chief Engineer GP Mehra, uncovering an unbelievable mountain of wealth.

title: Tourist Couple Spends Night At Singapore Airport As Hotel Rates Skyrocket On F1 Weekend
content: It seemed the couple came prepared as they laid out thin blankets and neck pillows on the floor for some good sleep.

title: Woman Dies After Medical Emergency On Disneyland's Haunted Mansion Ride
content: A woman in her 60s died at Disneyland in Anaheim, California, after she reportedly suffered a medical emergency on the Haunted Mansion ride.

title: Ukraine's New Lobbying Tactic: Nominate US President For Nobel Peace Prize
content: Ukraine has yet to convince Donald Trump to put sufficient pressure on Russia to force it to negotiate a peace deal, so it has deployed a new lobbying tactic: nominate the US president for the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: "Stay Within Limits": Mamata Banerjee Targets State's Poll Body Chief
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee sent out a stern message to the state's chief poll officer Manoj Agarwal on Thursday, saying he should stay "within his limits".

title: Garbage Truck Carries Medicines In Chennai, Civic Body Suspends Doctor
content: The Greater Chennai Corporation has cancelled the services of a contract doctor after a controversy erupted over medicines allegedly being transported in a garbage collection vehicle to a government health centre in north Chennai.

title: As Trump Guns For Peace Nobel, A Look At Other US Presidents Who Have Won It
content: The Nobel Peace Prize winner is set to be announced on Friday, and US President Donald Trump has made it clear that he believes the award should be his.

title: 'Give It To Trump: Netanyahu's Last Push For Nobel On Day Of Announcement
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu praised United States President Donald Trump, saying he deserves the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Liquor Case-Accused Andhra MP Seeks Probe Into 'Fake Alcohol Racket'
content: YSR Congress Party MP PV Midhun Reddy has writtento Union Home minister Amit Shah, demanding a Central Bureau of Investigation probe into the spurious Indian Made Foreign Liquor racket in Andhra Pradesh.

title: Tropical Storm Jerry Intensifies In The Atlantic As Hurricane Priscilla Weakens
content: Priscilla lost its hurricane status and was downgraded to a tropical storm as it churned up Mexico's western Pacific coast, while Tropical Storm Jerry strengthened in the Atlantic on its approach to the Leeward Islands.

title: On Live-In Relationships, UP Governor's "Women Cut Into 50 Pieces" Warning
content: Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel has sparked fresh controversy after publicly discouraging women from entering live-in relationships, linking it to violence during a convocation ceremony in Varanasi.

title: Drugs Worth Rs 72 Crore Seized In Hyderabad Bust, 4 Arrested
content: Telangana's Elite Action Group for Drug Law Enforcement (EAGLE) successfully dismantled a major drug manufacturing operation in Hyderabad, seizing a staggering 220 kilograms of Ephedrine with an estimated street value of Rs 72 crore.

title: When Leader Withdrew From Bihar Election After Rival Called Him "Brother", Sought Blessings
content: In today's politics, where ideology has been replaced by caste and individualism, and debates on election platforms often turn into accusations and counter-accusations, some stories from the past still offer solace.

title: Amid Cough Syrup Deaths, Madhya Pradesh Blames Tamil Nadu, Alleges Negligence
content: Madhya Pradesh still reeling from the devastating Coldrif cough syrup tragedy which has claimed the lives of 23 children, Chief Minister Dr. Mohan Yadav has directly blamed the Tamil Nadu government.

title: Draft labour policy violates tripartite process: AITUC
content: Discussions with the CTUs as the main stakeholders before drafting such a policy is a standard and crucial practice established in India

title: Goal is to create 1 lakh blue-collar jobs through OMCAP, says Lokesh
content: Instructs officials of Skill Development Corporation to prepare a roadmap and move forward in a planned and systematic manner to achieve the goal

title: BJP‚Äôs Manipur MLAs meet Patra, seek end to President‚Äôs Rule
content: The group of MLAs conveyed to State in-charge Sambit Patra that there is ‚Äúno infighting‚Äù within State BJP and that the Home Ministry should revoke President‚Äôs Rule and reinstate the popular government

title: ‚ÄòPeace talks‚Äô held in Leh; mobile Internet services restored
content: The first such meeting since the violence erupted on September 24 was chaired by Ladakh Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal; the meeting was attended by LAB chairman Thupstan Chhewang and co-chairman Chering Dorjay Lakruk, representatives of Buddhist organisations, Muslim bodies, Christian groups and leaders of the Congress and the BJP

title: PM Modi to launch initiatives to boost pulses production
content: Schemes target higher cultivation area, productivity; over 1,100 agri projects worth ‚Çπ42,000 crore to be inaugurated

title: Operation Numkhor: Customs seize three more vehicles
content: A Nissan Patrol, a Nissan Pickup Truck, and a Toyota Prado seized in Kochi. Total number of vehicles seized under Operation Numkhor now 43

title: Lok Sabha Speaker urges ethical adoption of AI to bridge the digital divide
content: Om Birla said that cooperation and knowledge-sharing can make technology a bridge rather than a barrier

title: Congress slams Modi‚Äôs praise for Israeli PM
content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh criticises PM Narendra Modi for failing to mention the ongoing expansion of Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank or the devastating toll of the Gaza war

title: India sees increase in international and domestic airfares from 2019 to 2025
content: The 2025 trends were released by the Airports Council International Asia-Pacific & Middle East, the trade association representing airports

title: Help excluded Bihar voters file appeals: Supreme Court to legal aid workers
content: Experience in State must have made EC wiser ahead of pan-India SIR, says court; information about the 3.66 lakh excluded from list should be collated by the legal service authority and submitted as a status report to the court in a week, it added

title: West Bengal Police arrest five accused in attack on BJP MP, MLA in flood-hit Jalpaiguri
content: Meanwhile, two petitions were filed at the Calcutta High Court urging a probe by central agencies into the attack

title: Supreme Court says retrospective age limits under surrogacy law violate reproductive autonomy
content: The top court was hearing applications moved by 3 couples who challenged the age bar of 23 to 50 years for women and 26 to 55 years for men under the Surrogacy Regulation Act, 2021

title: Singer Anuradha Dhareshwar is no more
content: The 87-year-old former announcer at All India Radio Dharwad was one of the earliest light vocal singers of Karnataka

title: India to launch ‚ÄòRed List‚Äô survey to assess extinction risks to plants and animals
content: India conducts comprehensive assessment of 11,000 species to determine extinction vulnerability, aligning with global conservation standards by 2030

title: CAG report flags flaws in e-way bill system under GST
content: CAG recommends government to get National Informatics Centre, which manages the e-way bill common portal, to correct the system deficiencies

title: ‚ÄòIndira food kit‚Äô to replace five kg rice under Anna Bhagya scheme
content: The kit will benefit about 4.48 crore population holding below poverty line cards and will include tur dal, oil, sugar and salt

title: BJP says seat-sharing talks between allies are ‚Äòpositive‚Äô; Chirag remains tight-lipped
content: Paswan says he has ‚Äòresponsibilities of the Ministry as long as he remains a Union Minister‚Äô, delivering a subtle message to BJP amid talks about seat-sharing for Bihar polls

title: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan puts aside politics for Kerala‚Äôs development in meeting with Union Ministers¬†
content: Pinarayi, who is leading a ministerial delegation consisting of Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal, Tourism and PWD Minister P.A. Mohamed Riyas, and a host of senior bureaucrats, holds successive discussions with Union Minister for Home and Cooperation Amit Shah; Union Minister for Transport and National Highways Nitin Gadkari; and Union Health Minister J.P. Nadda. He will likely meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday (October 10, 2025)

title: State yet to make rules for juvenile justice Act
content: Formulation of State rules will enhance efficiency of State Child Protection Society and district child protection units, says latest CAG report

title: Suspect in burglary case at doctor‚Äôs in Kozhikode house nabbed
content: A native of West Bengal,¬†who is suspected to have burgled 45 sovereigns of gold ornaments and ‚Çπ10,000 from the house of a doctor, taken into custody

title: Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Contestants back in the house as studio unsealed
content: Bigg Boss Kannada season 12 set to resume after studio seal lifted following the intervention of Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar

title: Naidu moots mobile Rythu Bazaars, modernisation of existing ones
content: The proposed master plan for modernisation should not only improve physical infrastructure but also include digital integration, logistics coordination and quality control mechanisms, says Chief Minister

title: CPI(M) seeks cancellation of hydro power projects, restoration of Epurupalem Strait Cut canal
content: The power projects in the Fifth Schedule areas violate tribal rights and environmental laws, says party leader Srinivasa Rao

title: KSRTC continues to give thumbs down to electric buses
content: Ganesh Kumar cites higher cost required for procurement, cost of setting up electric charging sub-stations, and annual maintenance expense after two-year warranty period as the reasons for not promoting more electric buses

title: Nobel Peace Prize: 4 US presidents have won top honours ‚Äî will Trump join club?
content: As the Nobel Peace Prize announcement nears, Donald Trump, a nominee, expresses doubt about winning, despite claiming to have settled multiple wars. Experts question his eligibility, citing his withdrawal from international agreements, which they argue contradicts the prize's aim of fostering fellowship among nations. Four US presidents have previously received the award.

title: Put ‚Äòcap‚Äô: Cab secy instructs ministries to minimise litigations; sends order
content: Government ministries and departments are directed to cap the number of court cases filed to prevent unnecessary litigation and resource wastage. Following a meeting with PM Modi, secretaries are tasked with analyzing judgments to minimize future legal disputes. This initiative aims to reduce costs and improve efficiency across government operations.

title: In talk with Donald Trump, PM Modi hails success of Gaza peace plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated US President Donald Trump on the "historic" Gaza peace plan and discussed "good progress" in trade negotiations. The leaders agreed to stay in close touch, hinting at a potential meeting. Modi also joined UK PM Keir Starmer in supporting the US peace plan, emphasizing a lasting and just peace with a Two-State solution.

title: In meet with Keir Starmer, PM Modi stresses need to move against economic fugitives
content: Prime Minister Modi and UK counterpart Keir Starmer met to bolster bilateral ties, focusing on defense cooperation, including military training and missile systems. Both leaders committed to enhancing collaboration in the Indo-Pacific and promoting multilateralism, with the UK reiterating support for India's UNSC aspirations. Discussions also covered economic trade, technology partnerships, and critical minerals.

title: Google changes work policy: ‚ÄòWork From Anywhere‚Äô can‚Äôt be used for WFH; sends memo
content: Google is reportedly tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, intended to prevent WFA from substituting regular hybrid work, has drawn criticism from employees for its confusing implementation and restrictions.

title: ‚ÄòAwaits peace President‚Äô: After Nobel nomination Israel invites Trump to address parl
content: Israeli Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana has invited former US President Donald Trump to address the parliament, calling him the "greatest friend and ally of the Jewish people." The invitation highlights Trump's role in brokering regional agreements and recognizing Jerusalem as Israel's capital. This marks a significant gesture of gratitude for his leadership and the US-Israel alliance.

title: Karnataka approves 12 menstrual leaves a year across sectors
content: Karnataka has approved a groundbreaking policy offering one paid menstrual leave monthly to women across all employment sectors, benefiting over 50 lakh individuals. This move, championed by CM Siddaramaiah, aims to foster a more understanding workplace. The state joins Bihar and Odisha in this initiative, with the Karnataka Menstrual Leave and Hygiene Bill, 2025, proposing 12 days annually for working women.

title: ‚ÄòI love Muhammad‚Äô row fallout: Raza gets recovery notice in 28-yr-old Rs 5k loan case
content: Bareilly administration has reopened a 30-year-old loan default case against cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza. He owes Rs 5,560 from 1990, now Rs 28,386 with interest. This action follows his arrest after recent violence. Authorities are also reviewing other financial and administrative irregularities linked to Raza's network. Demolitions and sealing of premises have occurred. This is part of a wider crackdown on alleged financial and administrative irregularities.

title: China to India: 'Promise' that rare earth magnets supplied will not be re-exported to US
content: China has tightened rare earth export controls, restricting processing technology and targeting defense and semiconductor users. Beijing is reportedly seeking guarantees from India that its heavy rare earth magnets will not be re-exported to the US, aiming to use these controls as a bargaining chip in trade talks.

title: Tejashwi Yadav‚Äôs big poll pledge: A government job for every household
content: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav, RJD leader and INDIA bloc chairman, has pledged a government job for every household in Bihar. He promises to introduce the legislation within 20 days of forming the government and ensure its implementation within 20 months. This move aims to address the significant unemployment issue in the state.

title: ‚ÄòNeed very badly‚Äô: Trump announces Arctic cutters deal with Finland
content: America is set to acquire 11 icebreaking vessels from Finland, a significant move to boost its Arctic presence. President Trump announced the deal, emphasizing Finland's expertise in building these crucial ships. This collaboration will see four vessels constructed in Finland and seven in the US, strengthening bilateral defense ties amidst rising Arctic importance.

title: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu sends ‚ÄòThank You‚Äô message to Amit Shah; dedicates it to engineers
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has switched to Zoho Mail, India's homegrown email platform, a move celebrated by Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu. This decision aligns with the government's push for digital sovereignty and boosts the adoption of Indian tech solutions. Shah's endorsement signifies a growing confidence in the nation's indigenous digital infrastructure.

title: Ayesha Curry‚Äôs 'no male attention' comments resurface, spark online backlash
content: Ayesha Curry's past comments about lacking male attention and her initial disinterest in marriage and children have resurfaced, sparking significant fan outrage. These remarks, made on "Red Table Talk" and the "Call Her Daddy" podcast, have led to widespread criticism and calls for Stephen Curry to address the controversy publicly.

title: PM Modi, Keir Starmer condemn terror in all its forms and manifestations
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK counterpart Keir Starmer strongly condemned terrorism, including the Pahalgam attack, and pledged zero tolerance. They agreed to counter radicalisation, combat terror financing, and prevent the exploitation of new technologies for terrorist purposes. Both leaders also expressed support for peace in Ukraine.

title: India's purchase of Russian oil figures in talks, says UK PM Keir Starmer
content: UK PM Keir Starmer confirmed discussions with PM Modi regarding India's purchase of Russian oil amidst the Ukraine conflict. Starmer highlighted the 'coalition of the willing's' efforts, including measures against Russia's 'shadow fleet,' aimed at ending the war. He also praised a peace deal on Gaza as a significant breakthrough.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in Abercrombie NFL collection; Randi cheers
content: Brittany Mahomes has launched a stylish new NFL apparel line with Abercrombie & Fitch, showcasing custom Kansas City Chiefs outfits. The collaboration, shot at Arrowhead Stadium, highlights her entrepreneurial spirit and family pride, earning praise from fans and mother-in-law Randi Mahomes. This venture comes as the Chiefs navigate a challenging season, with Brittany encouraging fans to support the team.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen‚Äôs former Manhattan townhouse lists for $17M after 20 years
content: Gisele Bundchen's former New York City home is now for sale. The elegant townhouse in Manhattan's West Village is listed at $16.995 million. Bundchen owned the property about 20 years ago. The historic home offers refined living space and modern amenities. This property represents a piece of supermodel history in a sought-after neighborhood.

title: Saquon Barkley injury update: Eagles star set to play against Giants tonight
content: Despite a recent loss to the Denver Broncos, the Philadelphia Eagles, Super Bowl LIX champions, are set to face the New York Giants. Star running back Saquon Barkley, who had a sore knee after the last game, has recovered and will play against his former team. Barkley expressed his understanding of football's challenges and the importance of enjoying the process.

title: Amid Donald Trump‚Äôs disinterest in Quad, India & Australia ink 3 pacts
content: India and Australia have deepened their defence cooperation. Three key pacts were signed to enhance information sharing and military interoperability. Both nations are committed to a free and open Indo-Pacific. This collaboration comes as regional security concerns grow. The agreements aim to bolster maritime security and strategic partnerships.

title: Former Bihar CM Karpoori Thakur‚Äôs granddaughter among 51 on PK‚Äôs first list
content: LJP(RV) has authorised party president Chirag Paswan to make all decisions regarding seat-sharing and candidates for the Bihar assembly elections.  Despite past actions, party sources confirm Chirag is not unhappy and will remain with the NDA. The party is seeking specific seats from allies, including JD(U), HAM(S), and BJP.

title: Mere use of abusive, defamatory or filthy language not offence: HC
content: The Bombay High Court ruled that using abusive or defamatory language alone does not constitute an offense under Section 294 of the IPC. The court emphasized that both obscenity and public annoyance must be proven with evidence. In a specific case, the court quashed charges under this section as no one was shown to be annoyed or the language deemed obscene.

title: Karpoori‚Äôs granddaughter among 51 on PK‚Äôs first list
content: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj party unveiled its first 51 candidates for Bihar polls, featuring professionals and leaders' kin, notably Karpoori Thakur's granddaughter. Aiming to offer an alternative, the list includes doctors, academics, retired officers, a lawyer, singer, and a transgender candidate, balancing caste equations and community representation to surprise voters.

title: I-T dept flags unreported cash property deals in Bihar and UP, asks sub-registrars to act
content: The Income Tax Department is investigating cash transactions exceeding Rs 2 lakh in property deals, particularly in Bihar and Uttar Pradesh districts bordering Nepal. Sub-registrars in these areas have been found to be misreporting and failing to share crucial data, including transactions over Rs 30 lakh and PAN details, prompting the department to seek state government intervention.

title: Priya Kapur behaving like 'Cinderella's stepmom', Karisma's children tell HC
content: In a Delhi High Court inheritance battle, Sunjay Kapur's children from ex-wife Karisma Kapoor accused his current wife, Priya Kapur, of behaving like "Cinderella's stepmother" and usurping assets. They allege Priya presented a forged will to restrict their share of the Rs 30,000 crore estate, seeking a probe into the alleged forgery and a status quo on asset movement.

title: Doctor reveals one silent sign that may appear days before a heart attack
content: Orthopnea, the struggle to breathe when lying flat, is an often-overlooked heart attack warning sign affecting 92% of sufferers. This symptom, frequently mistaken for anxiety or acidity, indicates blood backing up into the lungs due to a weakened heart. Cardiologists emphasize that orthopnea is a critical red flag signaling potential heart strain and the need for immediate medical attention.

title: Delhi to UK: Oppose illegal immigration, keen on legal mobility
content: India and the UK discussed illegal immigration during PM Modi's meeting with UK PM Keir Starmer. India reiterated its stance against illegal immigration, emphasizing its support for legal mobility and a recently signed migration and mobility agreement. Both leaders also highlighted the strengthening India-UK partnership as a beacon of hope amidst global uncertainty.

title: BJP likely to finalise candidates in PM Modi‚Äôs presence on Sunday
content: The BJP's central election committee is set to meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and senior leaders to finalize candidates for the Bihar polls.  Amidst ongoing "hard-bargaining" with allies, the party's first list of nominees is expected soon.  Seat-sharing talks with allies, including the LJP, are progressing positively, with the BJP and JD(U) likely to contest around 101-102 seats each.

title: 'Ended war': Trump gives timeline on hostage release; Gaza plan to be signed in Egypt
content: US President Donald Trump announced the end of the Gaza war and a ceasefire deal, expecting hostages to be released Monday or Tuesday. He plans a trip to Egypt for an official signing of the agreement. However, Hamas rejected Trump's proposed "Board of Peace" to oversee Gaza's administration.

title: Drone plot foiled: Belgian PM targeted in a jihadist-Iispired attack; 3 arrested
content: Belgian Prime Minister Bart De Wever was the target of a foiled jihadist-inspired plot involving drone-mounted explosives aimed at attacking politicians. Federal prosecutors announced the arrest of three suspects in connection with the case, which authorities say involved plans to use explosive-rigged drones against political figures. The swift action of security services and the judiciary averted a potentially devastating attack.

title: Women's World Cup: Nadine de Klerk's blitz stuns India; SA win by 3 wickets
content: Nadine de Klerk‚Äôs explosive 54-ball 84 propelled South Africa to a thrilling three-wicket win over India in Visakhapatnam. Despite Richa Ghosh‚Äôs 94 for India, South Africa recovered from 81/5 thanks to crucial partnerships from Chloe Tryon and Wolvaardt. De Klerk‚Äôs late blitz, featuring five sixes, sealed the game with seven balls to spare, giving the visitors their first nail-biting victory of the Women‚Äôs World Cup.

title: Will Donald come up trumps with a Nobel Peace Prize?
content: US President Donald Trump's open lobbying for the Nobel Peace Prize has become a subject of widespread mockery, with late-night hosts parodying his desperate quest. Despite claims of ending conflicts, critics point to his role in escalating others.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu pauses key cabinet meet on Gaza plan to take PM Modi's call
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu on the Gaza peace plan's progress, welcoming the hostage release and increased humanitarian aid. Modi also spoke with US President Donald Trump about the historic deal, which Hamas has accepted. The agreement includes a prisoner exchange and an end to the Gaza war, with hostages expected to be released soon.

title: Chaos continues in DDCA: Another jumbo Ranji squad; Rana a surprise inclusion
content: Chaos continues in DDCA as a jumbo 25-member Ranji Trophy squad is announced, with Nitish Rana a surprise inclusion. Rushed selections, delayed support staff appointments, and internal conflicts have overshadowed the process, while the committee controversially picked four wicketkeepers and relied on T20 performances to inform red-ball selections.

title: Happy Karwa Chauth 2025: Beautiful images, wishes, messages and quotes
content: Married women across North India observe Karwa Chauth, fasting from sunrise to moonrise for their husbands' well-being. This tradition, rooted in love and devotion, sees women dressing vibrantly and participating in prayer ceremonies. Modern couples increasingly fast together, reflecting evolving marital respect and equality. The festival culminates with moon sighting and breaking the fast.

title: Giants RB Tyrone Tracy Jr cleared to play vs. Eagles after injury scare
content: New York Giants running back Tyrone Tracy Jr. is set to play against the Philadelphia Eagles. He has no injury designation after a shoulder issue. Tracy's return is timely for the Giants' winning streak hopes. He expressed high confidence in his ability to perform. The game is scheduled for Thursday night at MetLife Stadium.

title: Bihar polls: NDA seat-sharing talks - is BJP in a bind after 2024 majority miss?
content: Indian elections on June 4, 2024, brought back coalition politics. The BJP did not secure a majority. This has made seat-sharing talks in Bihar challenging. Allies like Nitish Kumar's JD(U) now hold significant power. Smaller allies are testing the alliance's strength. The BJP must balance keeping allies happy with its own interests.

title: Education of Nobel Peace Prize-winning US presidents
content: US President Donald Trump has been nominated for the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize amid international endorsements. This article explores the educational backgrounds of the four American presidents who previously won the Nobel Peace Prize: Theodore Roosevelt, Woodrow Wilson, Jimmy Carter, and Barack Obama. It details their academic achievements, presidential tenures, reasons for receiving the prize, and current status, highlighting their diverse educational journeys from Harvard and Princeton to the US Naval Academy and beyond.

title: Why Nobel Literature winner Krazsnahorkai is Kafka's literary heir of despair
content: Critics have called him ‚Äúthe Kafka of our time.‚Äù The New York Times described him as ‚Äúa writer of haunting, Kafkaesque intensity.‚Äù The Guardian dubbed him ‚Äúthe Hungarian master of apocalypse.‚Äù Translator George Szirtes said his novels ‚Äúcome from the same Central European forest as Kafka‚Äôs.‚Äù

title: 'He deserves it!': Bibi says Trump should get Nobel; big decision on Oct 10
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu endorsed US President Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, citing his role in forging peace agreements. Netanyahu's office shared an AI image of Trump with the medal, following a recent ceasefire and hostage release arrangement between Israel and Hamas.

title: Punjab bodybuilder-actor Varinder Singh Ghuman passes away; actors pay tribute
content: Punjab mourns the loss of bodybuilder and actor Varinder Singh Ghuman, who passed away at 47. Known for his fitness achievements and roles in films like 'Tiger 3' and 'Kabaddi Again,' his sudden demise, reportedly due to cardiac arrest, has deeply saddened the community. Tributes have poured in from across the Punjabi entertainment and political spheres.

title: Deepika Padukone finally breaks her silence on exit from Spirit and Kalki 2898 AD sequel
content: Amid ongoing talks over her exit from Sandeep Vanga Reddy‚Äôs Spirit and the Kalki 2898 AD sequel, Deepika Padukone has broken her silence, addressing the gender double standards in the industry without naming anyone. In a recent interview, Deepika responded to reports that she had demanded fixed 8-hour working shifts.

title: Inside Coldrif plant: Rusty equipment among 364 violations found; deadly lapses exposed
content: Madhya Pradesh police arrested Sresan Pharmaceuticals owner G Ranganathan, 73, in Chennai after his cough syrup, Coldrif, was linked to 21 child deaths due to toxic chemicals. The company, despite operating with numerous violations for years, is now under national scrutiny, with its manufacturing unit sealed.

title: Vin√≠cius Jr. tops Team of the Week 4 in EA FC 26
content: winger Vincius Jnior has a 90 OVR card, awarded for scoring a brace . the 25-year-old is a threat to pierce any defense . he has scored 96 Pace and 92 Dribbling in the premier league .

content: the three pillars of autumn in America are the colors of fall foliage, the traditional colors of college football allegiance, bridesmaids dresses, bow ties and bridal gowns . the sun will rise and set on October Saturdays, those days shall be packed with the shifting hues of the trees aroud .

title: MLB division series: How Cubs and Phillies can get even, plus NLDS Game 4 lineups and analysis
content: the Chicago Cubs and Philadelphia Phillies avoided getting swept out of the playoffs . the Phillies have the edge in the starting pitcher comparison, with Game 1 starter Tyler Glasnow . we've got you covered with pregame lineups and keys along with takeaways .

title: Saquon about his production: 'Every year is not going to be like how I had it last year'
content: RB Saquon Barkley sat on a foam mat in the middle of the Eagles locker room . he exited the game with a sore knee that landed him on the injury report . the 28-year-old is expected to play against the team that drafted him no. 2 overall in 2018 .

title: Ahead of Delhi meet, Taliban seek India‚Äôs recognition for Islamic Emirate
content: amir Khan Muttaqi meets external affairs minister S Jaishankar on friday . he arrived in Delhi for a 6-day visit that is expected to boost India‚Äôs fast growing economic ties and people-to-people contacts with Kabul . it is the first high level visit by our foreign minister to India .
